page.title: 08LOCAL INDUSTRY.
page.content: DODWORTH COLLIERY:Employs 95 men.Is the outlet for the combined Dodworth and Redbrook Pits.The men descend at Redbrook and the coal is moved underground and brought to the surface at Dodworth.The coal is washed and sorted,loaded into railway trucks and sent for industrial use by rail. The surface workings cover an area of half a square mile,the largest part of which is occupied by the grassed over spoil-heap which dominates the village. RAILWAY:Carries mainly goods traffic,notably coal from the local pits.Coal trains carry about 900 tons of coal for the power stations.Recently the line has been reopened to passenger traffic carrying people from Huddersfield to Sheffield via Penistone and Barnsley.
